#MB++ Technical Manual
<br>--ARRAYGET-- </br>
<br> Gets data from an array.  </br>
<br> Set A, B, C or D to a number and it will be replace with the </br>
<br> character at that position in the array. </br>
<br> -Input:</br>
<br> A, B, C or D position in the array </br>
<br> $v array to use ($v = "a")</br>
<br> -Output:</br>
<br> A, B, C or D output from array.</br>
<br> -Notes:</br>
<br> There are 4 arrays and they are each limited to 100 positions.</br>
<br> Uses memory between 60000-60399.</br>
<br>Arrays do NOT edit your text variables. They are saved in memory.</br>
<br> -Used in:</br>
<br> (none)</br>
<br> -Uses:</br>
<br> ERRBOX</br>
